pros: Excellent work-life balance. Surrounded by really kind and talented people who care about each other. Work is meaningful and employees treated with respect and given opportunity.
cons: Edison is not the greatest location.

pros: Starting salary is typically strong.
cons: Management simply does not care about you in any way. Long periods spent in the core with no breaks or opportunity to take a minute to slow down. Merit raises are extremely low year to year. Bonuses are never on time. Expected to go above and beyond with little to no recognition whatsoever. Tech level’s are virtually impossible to get, making it hard to make adequate money.

pros: Products work, good company as a non-profit
cons: Politics affect who is out and when. Pretty savage.

pros: There are no pros. Nothing about working at this place is great. There are better companies and opportunities out there. Please seek other places. You will be miserable here.
cons: The management is horrible. No one takes accountability for anything and they want to work you like a slave. Upper management is making working here miserable. They suck the life out of you and provide no support. When it is time for them to throw you under the bus, they will, especially the HR department. No one cares about you. What matters to them is the company.

job_title: Referral Management Specialist in Wyoming, MI
pros: Off weekends work eight to five
cons: Little pay no real raise

review_title: Top Heavy Company on the brink of Collapse
pros: Benefits and PTO. Move in silence!
cons: Everything else not mentioned. There is no value for the gift of donation but there is value for the love of money/greed. The acceptance criteria for donated tissue changed drastically to accept less favorable tissue in hopes of increasing profit. This company is a complete sham by saying they honor the gift. This company has the most Supervisors, Managers, Directors and VPs I've ever seen! Yet, the staff is dwindling significantly. Any positive reviews are from newer employees who haven't had time to delve into the management issues. Also, forget any growth opportunities. Only close buddies are eligible. Some employees have held the ssme title for over 10yrs. Save yourself and apply elsewhere. Your mental health desrves better!

pros: MTF is focused on fair employee salary, benefits, and flexibility.
cons: Direction can sometimes be muddy. Employees can sometimes be over-worked.

pros: good perks and work/life balance Great onboarding and learning environment
cons: Very cliquey work environment that is not very inclusive low salary

pros: Benefits/Health Plan Mission for Patient/Recipient
cons: Manager is cocky and talks down to you and has no idea how to professionally manage people. Company is always putting surveys out and you are threatened if you tell the truth. Manager claims he can see who does what on the survey and your bonus will be cut. Trainer tells you to do one thing, someone else tells you to do another.

pros: Amazing Mission, A Chance to Make a Difference, Welcoming, Fair, Fun
cons: The systems a bit dated

pros: health benefits and pto are great
cons: finance not paid well or promoted

pros: Benefits activities and caring plenty of room for growth
cons: To top heavy need to make pays and grade level changes

review_title: Not a bad place to work
pros: Multiple shifts so you have some flexibility with work hours.
cons: Pay could be better. Management could use some work across all departments.

review_title: Not a medical job, factory style work environment
pros: Schedule and benefits are the only pro
cons: Pay rates, raises and bonuses are not consistent or fair. management doesn't communicate. Team leaders, techs and management do not conduct themselves in professional manners. pettiness and retaliation are common and accountability is a joke

job_title: Lead QA Analyst in Edison, NJ
pros: Good place to learn and experience industry
cons: Lack of general appreciation and promotions

pros: The mantra is saving and healing lives
cons: Poor management, favoritism, inequality, loss of valuable employees due to lack of experienced leaders

pros:
Not much downside of being a technician
Pay isn't terrible if you're just starting. Bad if you've been here a while.
Benefits
Values
cons:
They're starting to pay technicians more than team leaders making my job obsolete
Communication is dreadful

job_title: Wound Care Consultant in Raleigh, NC
pros: Great culture. Management cares about retaining team members.
cons: None really. There are hiccups in any organization but MTF mitigates those as needed

job_title: Laboratory Analyst I in Jessup, PA
pros: Lab is a great place to work. Great people
cons: Salary is too low for current market

job_title: Lab Analyst I in Jessup, PA
pros: Good Health Benefits and great mission
cons: No part time, no parental leave and terrible maternity leave. No advancement and salary is very low. Used to be a great place to work but not so much anymore. Management is micro managing. Director does not let own managers make any decisions unless they are run by her.

review_title: Great company but can use improvement
pros: Great company, family oriented, going to work isn’t a drag and you actually enjoy being there. Great benefits and incentives and we are off all holidays.
cons: A lot of drama, Too much favoritism, they treat you like children, you express your concerns and nothing changes. Communication between management and employees is terrible. Pay could be better for all that we do. All they care about is meeting production goals and don’t care too much about the quality of the tissue. They micro manage like crazy. like i mentioned if you don’t kiss their butts you won’t advance anywhere. It seems like those who sit in the supervisors offices all day are the ones who are shown favoritism.

job_title: Senior Process Engineer in Edison, NJ

Immediate coworkers and manager were great.
Good vacation time
Fun employee Events during normal working hours to build community. 
People who care about the mission and goal
Involved CEO
cons:
Stuck in the Past technology wise
Difficult to make meaningful change 
Bureaucracy due to "this is how we have always done it"
Too many VPs

pros: Work isn’t heavy and job security is there if you plan on staying for along time.
cons: Under paid and under value no communication. Place is full of broken promises. No foundation just full of favoritism and quality in the job itself has went down

pros: benefits are really good, people, location,
cons: lack of education of supervisors, favoritism

pros: Good benefits and paid time off.

pros: Job is pretty easy. people there are generally pretty nice. And the pay is good for the area and level of experience needed.
cons: Not much room for movement within the company. Management is pretty out of touch with employees.

pros: Good, flexible, nearby, bonuses, employee engagement
cons: Manager,no accountability, no teamwork, no recognition

job_title: Wound Care Consultant in Edison, NJ
pros: amazing non profit organization that truly is a pleasure to work for knowing you help make a difference is someones life.
cons: mtf is a large organization in NJ with other locations

pros: Good benefits, great work environment.
cons: There are no cons for working at this place.

pros: Good PTO, health insurance, vending machines,
cons:
hostile environment overall, low pay, no advancement.

Worked here for less than 1 year. The job itself is repetitive & boring. They pull uneducated people from off the streets. 
Management shows favoritism like there’s no tomorrow. If you are not a favorite you get ignored & bullied constantly despite your hard work. Supervisors can be mean-spirited and petty/catty for nothing.
As for coworkers, they gossip non-stop. They will also tell a million lies on you & supervisors will believe & will therefore harass you to no end.
Worst company I ever worked for. Never been at a company like MTF. If you love yourself, please don’t work here. Also turnover rate is very high for all the above reasons.

pros: The most important pro is mission !!! You push and do what you can to save and heal lives. Great benefits!!!!
cons: We could be little bit more 2021 when it comes to technology.

pros: Great company with patients in mind.
cons: Product availability and less than stellar marketing

job_title: Quality Assurance Technician in Jessup, PA
pros: Decent pay for the area and good opportunity to learn skills and leave. Great benefits and 2 bonuses.
cons: Management is horrible and they only care about making money. No longer care for gift.

job_title: Medical Device Sales in Charlotte, NC
pros: Non Profit, Great products that make a difference
cons: COVID, Product reimbursement, Goal setting issues

job_title: Lab Analyst I in Jessup, PA
pros: Great technical laboratory experience and free coffee.
cons: Zero room for advancement due to poor management. You will have zero opportunity to grow within this company unless you are friends with upper management. Quality Management is very political and there is a high turnover rate within that department( I wonder why).

pros: Good mission and great coworkers
cons: The lab management is terrible

review_title: Great Mission  Statement -If only they stood by what they meant.
job_title: Senior Process Technician in Jessup, PA
pros: Knowing you are helping to save or better a participants life is personally very rewarding .
cons: Very unprofessional environment, when it comes down to it, it's to more of a he say she says situation. They choose to pick who are known as their "favorites" side. HR is very poor never available when needed mainly at main branch in Edison New Jersey. Very hard to move up in company seems the more you work and the more you give them the less you get in return. Very poor supervisors on 2nd shift, half of the time they are not even available or do not show up for work, therefore they are never available when you need them. Upper management has been aware of this situation for over a year and a half now and has yet to do anything about it. Also have known to make inappropriate comments to female techs but of course you can not say anything bc of the fear of losing your job.

job_title: Associate Territory Manager in Detroit, MI
pros: Small company, you interacted with every level
cons: Small company and couldn’t grow because was not for profit

job_title: Surgical Consultant Executive Sales Trainer in New Brunswick, NJ
pros: No pressure, small copany with a large company feel. If someone is comfortable staying in a sales role and making a consistent somewhat decent living with out b micro being micro-managed this is the place for them. Its an easy role for someone strategic and that has the right skill set.
cons: There's cultural changes that are disturbing  and no room for advancement or professional development. I've been with the organization for 8 years and have only seen one sales person be promoted even though there's a significant amount of talent.  Also most of executive mangement all of which are very nice folks but clearly  do not seem to have the experience and expertise to drive the organization forward. Healthcare is evolving rapidly yet this organization is in no way progressive and runs itself 10 years  behind the times. Many decisions strategic decision regarding sales stradegy , new product launches ect are not in line with market demands and are counterintutitive. Once again the people are all nice and very pleasent but there;s a whole lot of incompetency. I don't see this changing anytime soon which worries me about long term survivial. I feel I have gain alot of experience in my 8 years with this organization and am thankful but I'd like to take my skill set and expertise to the next level.

pros: MTF Biologics has a good mission, positive culture and rewards quality work
cons: There are times when changes are made with minimal attention to long term effects and leadership communication needs improvement

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Edison, NJ
pros: benefits are very competitive and employees are very nice
cons: short break times and need more skilled trainors

job_title: Associate Scientist in New Brunswick, NJ
pros: Great company to work for and what they stand for.
cons: The mangers like to micro mange.

job_title: Senior Facilities Tech in Jessup, PA

pros: The company genuinely cares about all their employees. Top notch place to work!
cons: Honestly can't think of any cons to working here.

job_title: Senior Processing Technician in Jessup, PA
pros: Good pay and benefits and vacation at their discretion
cons: Nepotism favoritisms gets rid of older employees

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in East Brunswick, NJ
pros: Good benefits, 401K available after one year, over-time available, PTO, 3 weeks of vacation.
cons: 37.5 hours per week, bi-monthly pay, 2 shut-downs per year at fixed time (total of 10 days, vacation time will be deducted)

pros: Helping people and improving lives
cons: Overworked and underpaid, never enough staff

review_title: Sadly, not what it use to be.
pros: Coworkers who care about each other. Coworkers who believe in the integrity, and quality of their jobs.
cons: Too many employees from Rutgers University. Mid level managers are disrespectful to any one who is not at their level or beneath them. Department directors need to question the motives of the Supervisors/Managers under them. HR needs to be more apathetic to the little guy. In general this is a place that starts off well, but declines overtime due to the personalities of the people in charge.

pros: Good benefits (401k, PTO days, health insurance) that's about it.
cons: Extremely low salary compared to industry standard. Hard to move up, have to wait 1 year after each promotion to move up, which is a very weird rule. This isn't a place you work at to "learn" how to do things. Laboratory methods are outdated. Quality engineers don't really have a good grasp on how to handle projects. It's a bit of a mess, and more of a place to gain a few years of experience to put on your resume and get out. Poor departmental communication. Cut overtime opportunities across the board so now salary is extremely low. 10% max raise with promotions. Upper management thinks they are gods and know everything, but most of them have only worked at MTF and no where else. Overall just an embarrassing company where you don't learn much. Also going downhill financially, getting rid of holiday parties, extras, cutting OT and bonuses, frequent layoffs.

review_title: Great company with a good vision and cutting edge medical advancements
pros: This company has a solid mission statement to help the greater good in the medical field.  It has paved the way for tissue banking procedures and innovations with hard work and high standards.  I'm proud of what MTF does for the community. They uphold the donor gift and generously support many great causes.
cons: There is no opportunity for career growth.  Young, smart ambitious workers are not given incentives to move upward in their career and end up leaving for better opportunities.  Many employees who have been there for decades are complacent and just show up for the paycheck.  Some old ideas mainly stemming from the veterans there need to be refreshed.  Pay is low compared to industry standards.

pros:
Interesting product line
good benefits
professional atmosphere
cons:
Run like an army camp. 
Middle & upper management not on a friendly basis with professional employees who are mainly supervisors, technicians and coordinators.
Managers write you up for the smallest things that are questionable in many instances and 3 strikes and you're out the door.
Told by upper management that they're also afraid for their jobs and won't back an employee no matter how hard you work
Place is kept extremely understaffed and company buzz word is "Are you overwhelmed with the work load?"  Everybody is, and attitudes suffer because of it.
Employees in some departments monitored for performance on a MONTHLY basis to keep pressure on them.

review_title: More work than you can handle, so skip lunches.
pros:
Nice people 
Work environment has a family atmosphere
In general, good benefits.
cons: Management in the Research Department needs training. They have no backbone , when problems arise they tend to blame the people under them. Not a great place to work if you are use to being respected. Most times the PhD Supervisors treat the interns, and coworkers like children. Here's the rub: Some of the Supervisors are the same age as the coworkers. Also, they have a tendency to hire only people from Rutgers. Which is weird. So, in summary: Nice place, weird people.

pros: Employees are nice and friendly, Good PTO allowance, schedule is decent
cons:
This place is going to quickly crash and burn. So many mistakes made by upper senior management and they are trying to get out of a financial mess by taking out on their employees. Used to be nice to get 2 bonuses a year which made up for the poor salary you are given and know they are cutting them so low its not even worth getting a bonus.
They do not care about how long you worked here or how much experience you have employees have been in the same positions for more than 10 years with no chance of advancement.
Beware that there is nothing but dead end jobs here and the lay offs keep coming

review_title: I learned a lot about the meaning of life and how to save one.
pros: The people who work there are hard working people, but are still willing to put aside what they're doing to help you out. The hours were great. Everyone was as professional as possible.
cons: Sometimes miscommunication between departments. Which at times made things a little harder than they needed to be.

pros:
Great cause- it's work you can feel good about, and most everyone does.
great benefits- even after cuts.
supportive and professional co-workers reduce stress.
cons:
High workload- the attitude is get more done with less people, less time, less pay/benefit and don't question it, probably like many companies. There definitely is a threatened job environment right now and no-one's reassuring the general workers. 
NO transparency about ongoing issues, root causes of cuts, plans for the future, details of recent changes. Nothing- just weird political spin.

pros: all this company has going for it . Is that it does help people in need of bone transplants ... IE plifs. DBX puddy meniscus . besides that its a DOWN HILL RIDE
cons: what can i say its diffidently a BOYS CLUB.... got to work out eat right . Not to mention the poisonous atmosphere in the micro lab. 1 person get hired as a manager .... then all her buddies come following. many many good people left because of this. Some without any job to go to. that is how bad it was. Should have sued when i left due to all my calls and complaints to HR fell on deaf ears.

pros: I work with some great people
cons: Pay is not competitive. No advancement unless you're friends with someone higher up. PTO seems great but isn't. You get 20 days, ten of those go mandatory shut down, five of them are sick days, so you really only get five days a year to use as you please. They operate as "non profit", but most meetings are about how many millions they make off products.

pros: The company as a whole seems to value the people but didn't see that in my area.
cons: Very unprofessional environment and was subjected to vulgar language on a daily basis. The little training provided was performed by someone who couldn't answer questions. This is a dead end career job. I was left for several months without anything to do and was told at least once a week they would find something for me to do. Management rarely checked on me and the training was inadequate.

pros: GREAT place to jump start your career. Descent money and good on OT if your not forced into it.
cons: Donct expect to move up ranks without kissing someone's rear. Especially whole donor being Hispanic is rough it's the wrong ethnic. Supervisor's in processing in general must have been told they are God's and can treat people like crap. Always use the fear of losing your job and HR does nothing to repair the problem.

review_title: Extremely interesting project however not a great place for entry level
pros:
Cutting edge technology and varied options for project involvement
Knowledgeable project managers
Hours are reasonable with overtime pay for entry levels
cons:
Limited to no career growth, co-op are treated like temp technicians rather than engineers
Limited structure and no real incentive to stay with company
Pay is not competitive with industry averages

review_title: Wonderful mission but not enough focus on retaining talent.
pros: This non profit has a great mission. While I worked there, management regularly reminded workers that the work they did changed lives. This was encouraging and rewarding.
cons: When they hire, they tend to low ball employees on salaries. They also will not increase your salary by more than 10% with a promotion. As such, a lot of talent uses this company to gain a couple years worth of experience before leaving for better opportunities elsewhere.

pros: The benefit package and the friendly helpful coworkers.
cons: The management team in the QA area is very unprofessional and negative. You are micromanaged like children. This drives productivity and morale down.

pros: Good pay and free coffee. Also the vending machines are subsidized. Very clean buildings and bathrooms. I have nothing else to say but this section has a 20 word requirement on all post so yeah
cons: Work environment is pretty dull and boring. But what else can you really except from a corporate office setting. This section also has a 20 word requirement so yeah I have nothing else to say

review_title: How would you rate us overall?
pros: is a nice and friendly atmosphere with many new things to learn,it demonstrates that you job matters and helps people outside of the company i'm proud to call my new home
cons: I don't see any disadvantages at MTF Biologics

pros:
Mission driven
Work life balance
Great pay
Awesome benefits
Lots of PTO
Feels like family
cons: No work from home option

job_title: Senior Process Engineer in Edison, NJ
pros: MTF biologics is the best company that I worked for. I worked in big MNCs to startups, but I did not find any company that could come close to MTF. They value people, provide flexibility for work and life balances. They encourage new technologies and starve for changes. I am looking forward to contributing more to MTF.
cons: None that I could think of

pros: You gonna have the best exposure of your life as a tech for you will be working for someone to give a better quality of life i.e,needy recipients of ALLograft
cons: sometimes you work in a team with someone who she or he has a dislike for you no reason other than cultural diversity

pros: Good benefits, PTO, good company mission
cons: QA/Lab Management is inexperienced, play favorites and horrible micro managers. You get treated more like a child than a college educated adult. The pay is very low and there’s no room for advancement. The lab is full of negativity and bullies.  Work for the experience and move on. No one can make this a lifetime job to retire from.  One horrible manager hired a lot of terrible people that she promoted and are still there after she left.

review_title: Great experience, great company mission, easy to get complacent.
job_title: Senior Product Manager in Edison, NJ
pros: Top flight benefits, good working environment, worthwhile company mission.
cons: Would probably benefit from some additional transition in the management ranks. Lot of people have been there for a very long time (which can be both good and bad).

pros: Could not think of anything that is good about the Q department.
cons: You'll be harassed until you lose your mind and no one (including HR) is going to help. Stay far way from the Q department. I would not recommend you to suggest your worst enemy to work in the Q department. It's hel'l on earth in Q. The rest of the departments are not as bad.

pros: MTF has become a different place over the last few years. Need to work long hours to survive. Management only bothers about their own carrier and well being. NR will never help.
cons: Good benefits, free coffee. Good vacation policy.

pros: I work in Base Processing. Great benefits, great people to work with, supervisors are great. Willing to move people to different departments depending on needs. There are always opportunities for advancement if you just apply!
cons: Communication isn’t great but from my experience, no company is good at it

pros: Co-workers, benefits, company functions like picnics, Christmas party, community involvement with charities.
cons: Budget restricted non-profit company that limits chances of promotions and raises.

pros: Friendly coworkers and supervisors; rewarding work, excellent values, excellent benefit package,  bi-yearly bonuses ( to date), very accommodating with family time.
cons: No room for advancement, no leveling of salary after years of employment, daily use of hazardous tools (if you are not properly trained).

pros: Good health behefits and 401K
cons: Promotions are based on who you know and not the work you do

review_title: The longer you are employed here, the worse your career becomes

cons: This is not an employee friendly facility. The employees are overworked and underpaid. The longer you are employed here, the more pressure is placed on you, with threats of job loss, and raises are little to nonexistent.

pros: Some of the people here are amazing
cons: Poor pay, if you worked here for a while your salary and PTO are wonderful.  New employees, not so much
